miniGames.ships

Class Computer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • miniGames.ships.Computer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class Computer
extends Thread
    class Computer represents a computer player, stores the data of computer player and provides AI methods that let CPU to make moves and interact with opponent.
    Author:
    Wociech Stok≈Çosa
    See Also:
    ShipPlayer, ShipsBoard

      private int density
      spaces in wchich computer select coordinates to shoot

      • seekShoot

        private void seekShoot(int x,
             int y)
        Shoot at (x,y) and verify did ship is finished, or where to shoot next time
        Parameters:
        x - X location to shoot
        y - Y location to shoot

      • shoot

        private void shoot()
        Method called to shoot in opponent. Shoot in the area of 'unfinished' ships of opponent primarily, else shoots in counted coordinates

      • IGetShooted

        public int IGetShooted(int x,
              int y)
        Method called when the oponent shoot to this player
        Parameters:
        x - coordinate of shoot on the x-axis
        y - coordinate of shoot on the y-axis
        Returns:
        if ship is destroyed return 1, if there is a ship return 2, if there are no ships return 3, if CPU player lost return 4;

      • isLoose

        public boolean isLoose()
        get state of game
        Returns:
        true if CPU player lost, else in other case
